content.en: Digital Health Revolution: Algorithms are powerful tools that can predict medical outcomes and play a role in the adoption of person-centered care and consumer health technologies in digital medicine and health. They are also involved in the deployment of data-driven management and artificial intelligence in improving the health system. Digital health technologies, including artificial intelligence and machine learning algorithms, can transform clinical trials and lower their cost. These advancements empower patients, redefine well-being, and have implications for clinical pharmacists. However, ethical considerations related to beneficence, non-maleficence, autonomy, justice, and explicability arise from the use of algorithms in digital health. Overall, digital technologies are transforming healthcare delivery systems, impacting health, medicine, and care, but also raising concerns about safety, reliability, and equity.
content.da: Digital sundhedsrevolution: Algoritmer er kraftfulde værktøjer, der kan forudsige medicinske resultater og spille en rolle i vedtagelsen af personcentreret pleje og forbruger-sundhedsteknologier i digital medicin og sundhed. De er også involveret i implementeringen af datadrevet ledelse og kunstig intelligens i forbedringen af sundhedssystemet. Digitale sundhedsteknologier, herunder kunstig intelligens og maskinlæringsalgoritmer, kan forvandle kliniske forsøg og reducere deres omkostninger. Disse fremskridt giver patienterne mere magt, omdefinerer velvære og har konsekvenser for kliniske farmaceuter. Dog opstår der etiske overvejelser relateret til velgørenhed, ikke-skade, autonomi, retfærdighed og forklarlighed ved brugen af algoritmer i digital sundhed. Samlet set transformerer digitale teknologier sundhedsleveringssystemerne, påvirker sundhed, medicin og pleje, men rejser også bekymringer om sikkerhed, pålidelighed og retfærdighed.
